Senior leadership is incredible and will strike up a conversation and really get to know anyone, in any position within the company. I have even seen some of them stop to help a resident during a building visit. Truly a lead by example team. Being with Camden makes you want to strive for more and really push to help grow your community, as well as the overall company.
cons: To date... I am unable to come up with a real CON for working here.

title: Human Resources and Regional Management failed to follow up and provide a comfortable and safe work environment.
pros: Amazing benefits and a promise of great company culture.
cons: Human Resources fails to follow up or even initially reach out with employee harassment. What is also disappointing is that the Regional Managers do not take the lead to ensure that employees are not being harassed by residents and internal Camden employees even after it was reported multiple times. Ultimately I was looking forward to having a long and successful career with Camden but it is not worth the ongoing harassment and dismissive attitude from upper management and HR. Work place harassment is not taken seriously which is completely shocking as Camden is advertised as a “great place to work”. Career Growth is also difficult due to regional management setting appointments to provide career coaching and either failing to follow-up or cancelling multiple times. I did not feel valued as an employee.

title: Welcome to Camden High School
pros: Guest Suites, Flexible Schedule, Decent Health Benefits, Team Oriented, Beautiful Communities. Discounted Housing
cons: FAVORITISM. Lack of growth. The Orlando market is like a high school, you have cliques and people gossip constantly. Camden boasts a great work culture and there are SERIOUS flaws with some of the team members in Orlando. There is no point in contacting HR because concerns are often swept under the rug and no real action is taken. In the years I've worked here I have been sexually harassed, bullied, and retaliated against. It makes for an unpleasant work environment and I know of many others who have had a similar experience. Unfortunately, with my current financial situation I am stuck making it work or I would have left a long time ago.

title: A Company That You Can Believe In
pros: Camden at first felt a bit like Pleasentville with everyone all smiles and hugs, but you quickly learn it is not a facade. People are proud and happy to work for Camden - and with good reason. Camden fosters an environment where teams truly care about each other, their residents, and their communities. Teams have events together to build camaraderie and trust outside of the normal working relationship. The company goes above and beyond in putting people over profits as is shown in their commitment to volunteerism, monetary donations to their communities, and financial assistance to employees and residents in so many ways. Join the team and drink the koolaid!
cons: As with any company that allows you to share ideas and have run with new initiatives, there are times when you feel passionate about things that do not pan out.

title: Best Company to work for
pros: Camden is a wonderful company that embodies the word family. We are one unit working together to reach a common goal. Employees are empowered to make decisions that feel are best for the customer. Customer service is our top priority as well as happy employees. Camden's benefits are wonderful too and very competitive. There is also tremendous growth opportunity as Camden like to promote from within.
cons: Really the only 2 items that come to mind is that the communities are very sparsely staffed. I understand budget needs however for us to best serve our customers it would be nice to have 1 more maintenance staff and 1 more office staff added to the busier communities. Additionally when someone is out on leave, sick, or vacation it is hard to find coverage and work loads grow. Even though Camden just went through a detailed analysis of pay I believe all onsite positions including managers are underpaid for the work they do.

title: Fake
pros: Good benefits and decent pay.
cons: Thought was great company loved job. Managers often were lazy but not company fault. Work for them for 4 years till I got sick. Camden was supposed to work around my physical disability. Instead their attitude changed and they started treating me bad and would make job harder on me. Basically, pushed me out of job. Dr finally pulled me from work since they wouldn't work with limits. Went from feeling part of family to feeling like a burden.

title: Best Company to Work For
pros: I have been in the Multi Family industry for over 30 years, 10 years of those years have been with Camden. Camden's professionalism and the vision of the management team have made my time with the company and amazing experience. Camden is a people driven and family-oriented company. They keep their assets in great conditions, which makes it easy to be successful at work. Camden is committed to providing excellence at every point of contact to its employees and customers.
cons: Change is something that happens at Camden a lot which is great because it helps all of us to be competitive and outperform our competition. With that big said, I would like for the communication on new process to improved in order to avoid interruptions and delays.

title: Best place to work!
pros: Camden truly cares about every team member. From the initial training to the everyday atmosphere. This is a top down commitment and the Leaders within this organization are 100% focused on making sure every team member feels appreciated in every way. You are given the empowerment you need to do your job. They are open minded and always looking for ways to raise the bar and/or do something different to make a positive difference for the teams. They remind us often that they know the front line team members are the ones that are really making the company a success and you can feel that from day one. Camden gives back all the time, from an extra bonus, performance awards, peer selected awards to team member appreciation days. I could go on forever.
cons: If you don't want to work hard this is not the company for you. Other than that I cannot say that there are any real cons with Camden.

title: Camden is home.
pros: Safe and collaborative work environment, opportunities to have fun shared experiences, ability to be a part of something bigger than yourself, great paid time off benefits, employee vacation suites in every Camden market, 20% apartment discount, and competitive salaries. Camden allows you to be yourself regardless of race, background, sexual orientation, or age. I am part of the LGBT community, and Camden has offered same-sex medical benefits for as long as I can remember. Camden truly feels like a family, but that doesn’t mean that every single day is sunshine and rainbows, but what it does mean is that you all care for each other and work together to complete projects and initiatives with a common goal of providing the best apartment homes to our residents.
cons: Upward mobility is slow, and that’s because everyone stays at Camden longer than most. After all, it’s a great place to work.

title: CAMDEN IS AMAZING!
pros: Camden is a company that truly cares about and involves the employees in the company. The culture is unmatched and people that leave the company always say they miss it here. The generosity is high level having an employee relief fund to assist employees in difficult times. They recently gave 5M relief to current residents that were affected with loss of jobs and income. As an essential worker I didn't expect the hazard payment from Camden as I love my job and unlike so many that have recently lost their income was very blessed to have my job and still come to work. Every decision made by Camden is thought out so well and employees are always a great consideration. The leadership team is present and in front of employees with is why our culture is so LOVED. They connect and engage which is not typical in companies.
cons: Truly cannot think of ANY!

title: Top Companies to work for
pros: Some pros that I have experienced from working here in my 5 months are the people that I am surrounded by. Not only are my coworkers and residents the reason why I love my work, but also the company. The company rewards people that work hard! The benefits are also amazing! They have health insurance, company stocks, 401k, vacation suites, and many others! If you are looking to start your career and for a company you can grow with I definitely recommend Camden! Being open to failure is great at this company because they have you learn from your mistakes compared to reprimanding you.
cons: Some cons are that you have to be comfortable with talking with people. I started at this company with no experience in sales other then retail and a coffee shop. I definitely felt that there was a learning curve, but for sure you can over come it, it's just hard at first!

title: Do you like Kool-Aid?
pros: When you drink the Kool-Aid it's a GREAT place to work. But, you have to buy into the "company culture" completely. You'll work with some great people. My coworkers, trainers and area/district managers were great. Everyone was friendly and helpful. There is usually a good yearly bonus (that conveniently comes before voting for "best places to work")
cons: There are frequent changes to policy that don't much reflect what is most beneficial at the on-site level. Compensations has gone down and you're splitting commissions with maintenance more than before. Commissions are capped and you won't make much per lease. Camden gets voted as a great place to work, but grumbling from on-site employees leads me to believe that most of the people voting are the ones in corporate who definitely have it better. You'll work most weekends (if you have a good manager you may have at least one weekend off a month)

title: Almost Great Company
pros: Great management at all levels, good training, good benefits, they treat employees well.
cons: hours, compensation, working every weekend, threatening

title: Interesting job, not impressed with upper managment
pros: -Job was never boring and there was something different everyday -Decent benefits -Company encourages employees to have fun and have a 'family' atmosphere on the properties -Great mentoring program -Ability to make commissions and bonuses
cons: -Upper management does not listen or does not appear to listen to anyone on the properties except the property manager. -Upper management does not stand by their employees or enforce their own rules when it comes to the leases or the eviction process. It makes it difficult to manage a property when residents are allowed to violate their lease because upper management did not back the property staff and took the path of least resistence. This makes the property staff into the 'bad guys' and harms relations with the residents. -Work can be very stressful -Have to be able/willing to many changes

title: Technical Support
pros: Great benefits. You will learn how to step beyond your comfort zone. From the Vice Presidents on up, they are grounded, easy to approach and make it a positive experience.
cons: A Senior Admin once said the day to day feels like a circus. A former coworker said it’s like a high school click. I agree. Directors down through the ranks get too competitive that they lose focus of teamwork and get cut-throat.

title: Great company to work for!
pros: Camden is a great company to work for! Great perks and benefits and you can tell that the company really cares for its employees. Camden is great at hiring very positive, hard working and outgoing employees. I love that Camden offers non stop training courses. If you are someone new to this field like me it was a huge plus that Camden takes the time to train you and set you up to be successful in your role.
cons: The pay and commission could be better, leasing consultants are required to work every single weekend, difficult to maintain a good work-life balance, depending on your region their isn't a lot of growth due to lack of communities and long term employees

title: Great Company - Horrible Management
pros: Benefits are great through United Healthcare and very affordable. The is a ton of training classes as well as online classes. Great for development on your career and personal life.
cons: Growth is always there however you must be he popular person or a true brown noser to achieve. Management lacks the ability to lead. When you speak to the two upper management members they are too busy giving excuses and not seeking solutions.

title: Company must vary a lot by region
pros: Lots of systems in place to plug in to. Budgets are typically well allocated to implement said set in place systems.
cons: Every company can form cliques. With that being said I did not find myself appreciating or respecting the groups which were formed, and neccesary to join, to climb the hierarchy in my region and obtain promotions.

title: Not awful but not great
pros: Good starting pay Nice commissions for leases
cons: They expected an unrealistic amount of work to be completed within a certain time, yet didn't want to pay OT (which is what you needed to even get close to everything done they asked,) They also required us to show up 15 min before our scheduled time but we weren't allowed to clock in to avoid OT. Lol. Also- Depending on what community you're placed in can make or break you. I was in a community where the other office employees had a weird clique, made me feel isolated, like I was a nuisance when I asked questions, constantly passive aggressive, nitpicked EVERYTHING, it made me dread going into work everyday.

title: Favoritism, Racism, and Mean Girls
pros: Free food sometimes, good training
cons: No overtime, no fairness in work schedule, change management around a lot, no room for advancement, backstabbing, cheating, lying, bullying, upper management does not listen to or care about employees, people will do anything to make money, the property manager has your future in their hands, you can't apply for another position or job internally without the permission of the property manager, which is bad if they don't like you!

title: A great company to work for but the kind of job that consumes your life.
pros: The founders of the company really to live by the company values and it filters all the way down to the site level employees. They are a professional company and truly do their best to 'do the right thing' always.
cons: As a property manager I found the demands of my position were hard to meet. There is an immense amount of work that Camden expects to get done -- there just aren't enough hours in the day.

title: Values, Culture, and Employees are Priority
pros: Transparency; Wide-Boundaries to allow for creativity, opportunity to enhance operations, and have a voice; Employees are the priority of upper-management; a true family (genuine) culture; promotes a think like an owner mentality; has all the benefits of a large REIT (ESPP, career growth opportunities, a number of support teams, nation-wide ability to grow your career). Lastly, there is a benefit for employees who love to travel - you can stay at Camden Employee Vacation Suites for a small dollar amount. FUN!
cons: Consolidation of technology tools; the ability to enhance tools quickly (OneSite).

title: Great place to work
pros: Paid vacation, sick day and bereavement. Discounts on rent allow me to afford rent at a complex I otherwise would have been struggling to pay for! Camden holds themselves and their employees to a high standard. They have incredible resources to keep up updated with fair housing laws, and encourage us to be our best both at work and outside of work. I can't emphasize enough how many benefits they have!
cons: Like any leasing consultant job, you have to have tough skin and understand it's a competitive job. Being lazy in this position is not an option and it can be difficult not to take the job home.

title: Great Place To Work
pros: Most of the employees were treated with respect and appreciated. The company "cares" and values their emloyees. Great benefits and great communication within the departments and between the regional office and corporate headquarters.
cons: Some of the upper management didn't pull their own weight. Corporate office tolerated this behavior for too long causing low morale at the regional offices. Disappointed that the "path of least resistance" was the way issues were handled until situations escalated and were forced to be dealt with thru the legal system. Senior Upper Management was viewed as weak and ineffective in some cases.

title: Company actually cares about you and your development
pros: Always offering opportunities to learn, management wants you to set goals higher than just leasing, pay is great, benefits are AWESOME. They have something called the "Camden Soapbox" where you can share ideas on how to improve the company or things you don't like, and they respond pretty often to the ideas and implement the ones they can.
cons: Working weekends is tough when you want to hang with friends. Hours are shorter on weekends though which is nice. A little stupid that they want to you get a minimum of a certain number of follow ups (phone calls, emails, etc.). Sometimes dealing with residents can be super annoying, but that is not Camden's fault.

title: Great company to work for! But not the best work schedule if you love your weekends.
pros: I've enjoyed working at Camden so far! My coworkers are really great and helpful from the beginning. The people from corporate and other communities that I've met have been really nice too. There's a nice discount on your rent and it's easy to make extra money with commissions too. So that's a lot of added money above your hourly rate.
cons: The downside of working here, well honestly it's just the industry, is working weekends. Also, sometimes I feel like I'm doing work that goes a bit above my job responsibilities. Lastly, some of the residents and people you encounter are not the best and you just have to have thick skin. Some of these people will say anything and I wish I can set them straight, but I have to think of the Camden brand when talking to these people.

title: Upper Management has Poor Communication
pros: Holiday bonuses. Lots of holidays off. Good culture. Amazing training which is great for when it's time to leave you have a better edge over the competition.
cons: Upper management has poor communication. The current upper management duo make working for camden a bad experience. Camden boasts on internal promotions but when you apply they don't call you they don't reach out to you and completely ignore you. No development plan is set up and this causes employees to feel under appreciated and is the reason for high turn over. The pay is lower than surrounding companies in the area. The incentives are lower as well which is strange considering the high rents that camden charges.

title: Best in the business!
pros: Camden goes above and beyond to exceed expectations day in and day out! Not only for their employees, but their residents as well. High energy and enthusiasm is a value we hold very close to the heart. Safe, fun, and productive work environment is the name of the game. They did an incredible job managing and prioritizing safety through the pandemic. Could not recommend a better career path to take for property management! Camden promotes internally which provides an incredible opportunity to climb the ladder. Overall, 10/10. Come ready to work hard and you will be met with open arms!
cons: Scheduling can be tough at times, be prepared to work some weekends. But they offer ample vacation time and PTO!

title: Great Culture with High Expectations
pros: culture, opportunities, people-driven, and progression
cons: strained work-life balance and underpaid

title: Camden's Really A Wonderful Place
pros: I want to send a HUGE Thank You to Emily Coleman and Camden Property Trust. I’ve been enjoying my Camden family much I’m settling in well. I believe its safe to say that Camden does care for everyone and holds high integrity and value. From the moment you contacted me about this position I didn’t know exactly what I was going to do with the multiple opportunities I had and wasn’t sure if you were being transparent with me or selling me Camden. After the constant communication and interviews I Believe its safe to say you were VERY Transparent, Welcoming, and Honest. So selling me Camden was selling me the truth which I love about this company.
cons: Haven't really found any hopefully I don't.

title: Family Oriented Company
pros: Flexible work schedule to accommodate work life balance. This has been a tremendous benefit for me. I juggle 4 kids with my husband. Being able to work around their schedules allows me to be apart of all the important events in their lives. Not wasting time in traffic due to a strict schedule was another bonus. Many of the projects I work on is Camden's effort to give back to the community. Knowing the properties we built improved someone quality of life after they have lost so much adds meaning to my work every day. Last but not least, we always include having fun. From skits, costume contest, happy hour, Camden Socials, tournaments, games, parties, we have fun as an individual, team, department, or company.
cons: Sometime we have too much fun I can't get all my work done.

title: Better than most
pros: Camden is a great company. They give managers and assistant managers a company card which is often used for free employee lunches. Pay is pretty good and so are the bonuses. They are definitely far ahead of many of their competitors when it comes to technology. Camden is completely paperless and always improving current systems to make things go smoothly like a well oiled machine
cons: Like a lot of property management companies there is clear favoritism. there has been a lot of turnover in the Atlanta region over the last couple years for several reasons.

title: I LOVE Camden!
pros: Where to start? Camden has such a wonderful company culture about them that truly sets them apart from the competition. This culture is across all markets, too. Not just where I work in Raleigh! From the Mid-Atlantic all the way to California, the at home feeling you get as soon as you come to work is consistent - I never feel as if I am going to "work"... I'm always excited to come in and get people a new home and to share the Camden Culture. Also, Camden has so many great benefits for their employees that continues that trend of setting them apart. When I was an Intern with Camden in the Mid-Atlantic I knew from Day 1 of that experience that I wanted to become a member of the Camden family. Permanently.
cons: None at all - Camden is the place to be!

title: Great Company: Let's Keep moving forward
pros: Perks such as help with childcare costs, 401k matching, vacation suites, and various employee discounts. Promotion and additional responsibility opportunities especially if you are willing to relocate Ample resources and opportunities to learn within all roles. Adequate vacation and sick time
cons: Pay is starting to be less competitive with rising housing costs in the area. Lack of Diversity or Sensitivity/ Inclusion Training Little to no work from home opportunities for most positions

title: Must be a people's person
pros: -Good 1st office job if you have no office experience; -Office working hours + every other weekend; -Good benefits
cons: -You must be a very patient person to deal with residents. You will get paid hourly+ commission on the apartments that you lease, however; most of the time you will be dealing with not-polite, picky, screaming residents; -There is not much opportunity for growth- I know people who have been in the same job position for years- and they were good employees; -Commissions are not that good- it's better to just get a job at a bank- better hours and better pay

title: Management
pros: Great benefits, fun culture, continuing education at all levels. Community service, 20% apartment discount.
cons: Too much inconsistent policies that continue to change very frequently with the expectation that everything that is being requested to get done can be done all in the same day. Fair trying to follow policy is almost near impossible when team leaders are giving in to every gripe and complaint from residents after being told that we are not to remove charges or things dealing with making exceptions to policies made by Camden. Very unsettling. Many tenured employees leaving Camden at the corporate office. Very unsettling as well.

title: Good Company Overall
pros: I love the team I work with. It is a very family oriented work atmosphere as well. Great benefits, commission, and good time off after you work here a while!
cons: Wish the pay was a little higher. We do get incentives to live on property, but even with the 20% discount, it's hard to justify living on site if you are the sole income for your family. I haven't been here long enough to get the end of year bonus, but I'm hoping that it is nice bonus. So with that said, I don't completely know what my yearly salary would be.

title: Workplace Excellence!
pros: Camden is built on core values that allows us to be empowered and have fun. Camden offers a number of different programs we can participate in such as the mentor program, Camden blogs, management advisory committee as well as some creative teams for our awards ceremony and conference skits. Camden offers great perks for it's employees - my favorite is the corporate suites. Benefits are great as compared to previous employers within the same industry.
cons: As every workplace has it's room for opportunities - I would have to say that head count per property could be reviewed for improvement. Seeing that Camden is such a great place to work for the number of upper management positions rarely come available leaving little room for advancement.

title: Best company to work for
pros: •Incredible culture •PTO is great and increases very fairly with tenure •Onsite training and team building •Quick access to business support •Employee Perks are awesome! $20/night stays at sister communities around the country. •Opportunity for growth is high. •SoapBox to share your ideas and with a majority vote, some truly get considered! •Strong Values
cons: •Lower end employee discount (20%) , I have noticed many companies that offer a greater discount- up to 50%. I’ve also seen employees at other management companies who pay only $500/per month for living at the community they work at. If a higher discount is not possible, a no renewal increase would be nice. Employees don’t want to use PTO to move because of high renewal increase. The 20% discount is still fair and of-course, better than no discount so this doesn’t change my overall rating.

title: Good but not all it's cracked up to be
pros: Great benefits Corporate office is amazing Comprehensive training programs Competitive pay and commission
cons: Corporate and on site culture are very different. When I first got hired I was told all of Camden was like a big family. So far as an on site team member I have not experienced that at all. They also place (in my opinion) too much emphasis on a college degree. There is no position working on site that requires a degree, and team members with years of experience but no degree should not be considered "less qualified" for those positions.

title: Best workplace and people
pros: Wonderful Benefits, Caring management, happy workplace, awesome employees.
cons: Having to always work on weekends.

title: Amazing Company
pros: The most amazing Culture of any company out there. Govern themselves by a set of values that is easy to fit within your own personal values. Focused on individual growth and opportunity. Smart business practices that blends customer focus and duty to shareholders which is never easy. You are given more tools, training and resources than you could even use. Cutting edge and very progressive.
cons: Can be difficult for some to see opportunity for growth if they restrict themselves to only one location. Pay in some positions in some markets not appropriate to averages within that market.

title: Great Place for Positive Individuals
pros: Set schedules with two days off consecutively, positive working environment, amazing management all the way up to the top of the company. There will be opportunities to grow in your role and up to the next. You will mostly be working around others with high standards of work ethic and it makes you really feel proud of your accomplishments because of that. Great benefits, plenty of bonuses and a great opportunity to make friends with others who are a higher caliber than most competitors.
cons: You will be required to work weekends (not an issue for me, I like being in on the bigger sales opportunity days). The expectations for you will be higher than most other property management companies (again, not an issue for me as I like to keep busy at work).

title: High Standards
pros: * Frequent opportunities for Advancement * Team development * Flexibility * The high standards expected of the teams lead to a lot of job satisfaction as you will feel accomplished with the excellent experience you are able to provide for your residents.
cons: * Cons are crushed by the pros. *Not a job for someone who wants to sit back and twiddle their thumbs all day - Consensus amongst team members with experience at other companies is a whole hearted, "I would never go back."

title: Great place to work!
pros: I started with Camden in April of 2022, it is now October 2022. For the 6 months I've been here I have always had the best experience with everyone. With this company, you don't just get coworkers you get a bonus family. Everyone is so kind and eager to teach you new things! Never once I have been turned down when asking to get help or get taught something new. If you're looking for a place where you can grow Camden is the right company for you. In the short time I've been here I have reached the goals I set for myself. I am now working on a new goal and I am so excited to see where Camden takes me next!
cons: I don't have any cons Camden is just overall a great place to work!

title: Camden Culture is Hit or Miss
pros: Pay is pretty good, I do LOVE the new department I'm in because it embodies the Camden Culture I fell in love with when I was first hired.
cons: Culture not consistent on-site. Many times we are micromanaged and there is a lot of passive aggressive behavior from CMs.

title: Fantastic Company -Trust me you want in on this!
pros: Camden offers excellent career growth opportunities, amazing benefits and real team spirit. You meet tons of amazing people in all departments. Lots of education and development, great work environment, fun events, 401k, stock buy in, paid holidays, bonuses, awards and tuition reimbursement. This company shows me again and again why they are simply the best. We have a unparalleled fun, corporate vibe and team spirit and you have so many opportunities to grow professionally.
cons: Be prepared to work hard as well as play hard. If you are driven and motivated and like to tackle a full work day this is a career company for you. You need to be a motivated, committed, self starter. You won’t be bored, I promise!

title: Good Company Overall
pros: Good open-door policy. Awesome company culture and they give back to the community. The perks are great from guest suites, year end bonuses, and employee fun days.
cons: Career advancement is based on favoritism. If you are not “memorable” then all your hard work and effort will be for nothing. On some occasions it seems that even when you bring an issue to HR or upper management no action is taken.

title: Camden is truly an opportunity for anyone to develop.
pros: Leadership truly does care about each individual team member and their development. It is not often that you find a company that genuinely cares about making their employees happy and helping them to find the perfect spot within the Camden team. The resources that the company provides for both in and out of work are incredible, tons of perks that come along with joining the Camden Family.
cons: Depending on the market you are in, there may not be many opportunities for upward movement. (This isn't really a con, but many people end up being here for their entire careers, so it is not often that positions come available.)

title: Cultish company
pros: The company is great until you try to move up. The owners of the company are amazing leaders but they have some people that have been with the company for decades that are like an existential rot that destroy their ability to grow.
cons: There is no room for growth. They have the lowest paid employees in the industry and try to brain wash their employees into thinking they are the greatest company ever to work for. The people in the company are only friends with each other and if you do not join their "cult club" they will fire you. also, there is a network of women high-up in corporate that have known each other since grade school. If they do or say something unethical, you better look away or you will be fired.

title: Overall great company
pros: Great benefits, positive culture, plethora of resources for success, internal growth is competitive but very possible.
cons: Every company will have it's cons but overall nothing major to contribute. Obviously the industry is customer facing so you often experience negative encounters with customers. Definitely not for the faint hearted.

title: Best company I've ever worked for!
pros: Working for Camden Property Trust has been the best work experience so far! I'm beyond grateful to be working for such a great company and I couldn't ask for a better job than this! The hours are great and the job is never boring when you get to work side by side with the kindest souls.
cons: The only cons would be if you didn't like the position you were in, in which case, it's so easy to talk to your lead or manager and they will guide you with a smooth transition to where you feel most comfortable.

title: Great culture with OK advancement opportunities
pros: The best part of Camden is the people you work with... and MOST of the customers as well (but that is the same everywhere). Management will support your growth if you seek it out.
cons: Lots and lots of things to do that pull you in multiple directions and it does get stressful. Less compensation in commissions than other companies (offset a little by the great culture). Not much opportunity for growth because high tenured employees don't leave and Camden is not expanding rapidly at this point to create those opportunities.

title: Tenure based not performance based!
pros: If you have zero education but are outgoing and looking for a fun environment, then this place is for you! If are willing to wait years for a promotion you can earn in minutes then you should go for it!
cons: Micro managed, dramatic, political, unprofessional, uneducated, uninspired & dysfunctional are just a few of the words I would use to describe Camden. Management earned positions based on tenure not on customer service skills or management ability. I went in motivated and inspired, 2 weeks in I was treated like a child and micro managed beyond belief. My manager took. 2 hour lunch breaks and ran personal errands during work hours. I was not allowed to share my ideas or bring any concerns to management. Issues with residents were not a priority. Absolutely, the worse company to work for. Disappointed.

title: Amazing Culture!
pros: -The culture is my favorite thing about about working for Camden. From day one everyone is extremely welcoming, helpful, and love to have fun. There's a perfect balance of professionalism to being able to loosen up and joke around. I've met so many wonderful people in my first year here. -showing appreciation of your team members is a common theme. I've always felt like a valuable player and that my opinions and ideas are impactful. -Abundant learning opportunities, resources, classes, and aid. -Great bonuses. -Great work/ life balance. -Great healthcare and financial planning benefits. -My community is a beautiful, well- kept property to work at
cons: -Staffing shortage is a common stress. That may have something to do with the recent vaccine mandate. -Leasing incentives could be better.

title: Great CEO's, Horrible Bosses
pros: Love the culture that is promoted by corporate and the CEO of the company, however, it becomes nothing more than a dream as it trickles down to land on local leadership. There was a lot of ego, favoritism and sexism displayed from my regional manager and other people in positions of authority. Unfortunate, as the company values and way of choosing to do business is on point. One of the best things about Camden is how they train their employees and equip them to know how to do their job well.
cons: Leadership goes unchecked and is not held accountable. Pay is ok and very little chance for advancement as their portfolios are small in many areas.

title: Review from a Property Manager
pros: Overall, a great company to work for with lots of training, opportunity and perks. I worked as a manager at a community for a little over 4 years. Bonuses and 401K were great. I always felt like I was working for a company that had values similar to my own.
cons: The company expects too much from its employees; there simply aren't enough hours in the day to get done all the things you are responsible for. On top of that, there was frequent travel for meetings and conferences. I felt like the job sucked the life right out of me.

title: Not bad, not great!
pros: The majority of the people are great to work with. Pay is not bad. Employee events are well thought out and are fun. 401k growth plan is awesome. Stock purchase options.
cons: Not enough training, huge disconnect between regional management and onsite management. Soapbox only works for changes that don't require much money if any. Over the past year it seemed that the company started to head in the wrong direction for employees by changing or making policies that affected the employees negatively. Benefits are not that great. Little room for advancement, and constantly short staffed.

title: The Best of the Industry
pros: - Great hourly pay. - Incredible company culture. All communities close for company awards and an event called "Fall Frenzy" every year. Easy to make friends and have someone to reach out to if you have questions. -
cons: istency is key. Every property uses the same software, with the same policies and procedures, which makes it easy to reach out to someone for help. Everyone receives the same training, which is engaging, interactive and useful. - Camden cares about employees and residents equally.

title: Trustworthy Company
pros: FANTASTIC culture - you will know your culture, values and mission. Great work life balance Endless training that has real value. Onsite teams are incredible and you grow so close with your teammates Real support from corporate level to really live the value of 'Work Smart' Opportunity every day to do the right thing for your customers, your colleagues and yourself.
cons: Very, very few but it is tough to be up for a promotion opportunity along with 10 other colleagues that are extremely talented. It may take a very long while to move up. Camden really promotes from within so get in on those entry level positions and then stick with it!

title: Great Company Better Management
pros: Company culture CEO’s Pay is decent
cons: My overall issue with my experience was primarily management of staff on site. We have to do a better job at removing emotions (being more professional in our interactions ) and being cliquish. There was a lack of understanding of specific roles. I observed and experienced the LC being treated as the AM. Everyone was not treated fairly because there were close knit groups and that made it hard for new team members coming in. I Left shortly after because of this and for being blamed for things I did not do.

title: Choose wisely
pros: The pros of this company is the actual company itself. Great benefits, great culture, with very little turn around rate for the upper management positions.
cons: In contrast, the lower level positions of the company get worked very heavily. Expectations are high and the salaries and bonuses are just getting smaller lower down the todem pole. CHOOSE WISELY when it comes to what position you want in this company, don't just jump in because of the name, reputation or reviews of this company. A money grabbing manager (there are several) and tireless hours of reaching unrealistic goals will burn you out quickly.

title: Used to be the best in their class....but became too greedy and lost their culture.
pros: Great benefits! Great technology! Pretty okay training. Access to resources to help you perform well.
cons: The company has changed over the years. They have gone from being customer focused and first to being money driven and its sad. They overwork their employees and fire them over personal reasons and not performance reasons. Managers fear their supervisors and it trickles down. They used to tell you its okay to make a mistake because you learn from it. Now its just become a hostile and unhealthy environment to work in due to over analyzing yourself to make sure that upper management will approve. They are the best property management company, but at what cost are they willing to take. They've lost a number of long term employees. The employees used to love coming to work for Camden because they had great values and put their employees first and cared about the residents. Not any more.

title: Company has Terrific Promise but Inconsistent Execution
pros: Compensation plans are very generous to community managers and maintenance supervisors. This is especially so, given the bonus structure to include stock rewards annually. Lease up programs are also very generous with the stabilization bonus trip. There are also bonuses in place based on company performance alone and are in addition to individual or property performance. The option to have a discount at any community and extend that to a family member in lieu of the employee is also very nice. Specific markets are more challenging, given limited inventory, geography constraints, and or pricing for housing. Training for associates is extensive and Camden does offer a spectrum of resources to set associates up for success. The mentor on-boarding program is a terrific introduction to the culture and sets an example of the tone the company looks to incorporate. Camden does a lot to create their brand and provides on site management with tools to “do the right thing” for their customers. The flexibility of managing operations and making financial decisions is a big win for the organization. It offers autonomy and buy-in. Support departments and community online resources are well stocked. Camden seems to have support person for every department and or role. This makes on site operations very streamlined. Engaging with these departments at the annual conference is also a huge help and creates long lasting bonds. This extends to the CEO’s and board members alike. All of whom are engaging, warm and create an experience unlike any I’ve seen at other companies. While the search feature for online support needs some tweaking, the information available is expansive. The online dashboard is also an invaluable tool and takes a huge burden off of operations and also offers universal transparency. The business services team is also very forward thinking and is constantly looking to provide helpful and ingenious platforms. While the progress is not always over night, it’s supportive to see that it’s in motion. The IT department is also extremely responsive and apt to provide a same day resolution. Upon start date, all login criteria is made available and team members have instant access to necessary platforms. The development team is a well oiled machine. You can tell how effective the collaboration process is and the projects show that in the thoughtfully curated details. While Camden doesn’t operate everywhere, the new and redeveloped sites are typically well-thought and meticulous.
cons: Growth is limited unless you are willing to relocate to another market both outside of your regional city and or state. California specifically has only 12 properties currently in operation and very limited development in the pipeline. Compensation should be evaluated on a regional level and based on the cost of living. Offering a universal housing discount doesn’t create a competitive offer when you compare markets like Houston and Phoenix to Miami and Los Angeles. While the company is competitive within the REIT world, they operate in markets that are saturated with third party and private competitors. Within these specific sub-markets, fully comped units and percentage-based leasing incentives offer enticing packages and ultimately provide sustainability in very cost-prohibitive locations. Rather than working in a reactive manner, to counter offer associates who are leaving, or adjusting base rates after associates have left, a more in-depth market analysis should be created. Over the past year the company has seen onsite turnover for over 2/3’s of its community managers. Long-standing team members with 8-10 years of tenure have now dwindled down to 4 years or less. This turnover exposure was also mirrored in subsequent roles such as the maintenance supervisor and assistant manager roles as well. The Los Angeles market alone, saw turnover for all three of these roles at over 66%. Employee disengagement is a direct result from a lack of leadership. The regional office for Southern California is lacking in connection with its on site team members. The absence of support has systemically translated into devaluing great employees. Expecting high performing team members to burden the excess of vacant roles is not a sign of true leadership. Team members are not motivated by affirming words of encouragement alone. Tangible support efforts, strategic operation-based planning, and a “boots on the ground” approach would all yield more productive and team-based results. What’s more, hiring regional level supervisors who are new to their role, new to Southern California, and or have never worked in the Los Angeles market, are missed opportunities that not only put the supervisor at a disadvantage, but the on site team as well. For a manager in this position to then utilize a 4 hour monthly visit, in order to have adequate understanding of the market and or their site team, is beyond unreasonable. Local communication for career opportunities is disappointing. Employees often know ahead of time who will be given a role and this has been communicated by regional management. The unprofessional politics and discouraging communication to employees is very disheartening. With the open communication culture the company strives to create, upper management should be more tactful in their approaches. Follow through is also lacking. Employees should be provided with a career path and direction, rather than simply being told that they are not the right candidate. Training programs are still a work in progress. Limited in-person training is not effective and travel to corporate office for training is not the best use of time, especially given California’s challenging traffic. Some material is also out-dated, not market specific, and is not role specific. For example, plans should be created so that managers are not taking leasing 101. Maintenance is also being directed to take training for cost saving operations wherein the regional expense savings do not align with the rest of the US. Development plans have become exercises instead of training tools. Management lacks commitment to consistency and follow through. Strategies and communication protocols also change on a monthly basis, making expectations confusing. While this experience has become a reality in Southern California, it does not appear to have the same effects throughout the country or at the home office in Houston. All of which make the Southern California market the more disappointing.

title: Happiness Matters!
pros: What I love about Camden is how everyone makes you feel like you are part of a family. Also known as the CamFam. Everyone knows your story and supports you through your Camden journey. Your happiness matters to our company. If you want a change, or have an opinion, Camden listens and embraces your opinion. We have a Soap Box platform which gives your voice an opportunity to be heard. Our leadership listens, your peers and company then vote on your ideas. Then those ideas are discussed and change happens. Camden wants your ideas and input to be a part of something bigger. Its an inclusive company where you feel part of the big picture.
cons: Consider more flex scheduling for the leasing team.

title: Camden is not just an employer it's a family
pros: Leadership is listening and finding ways to make things happen when they hear new ideas from on-site teams. So many amazing changes have come like being closed on Sundays. Scholarships for our kids college. Employee suites. Grants during covid for team members and residents too. I get to work with the kindest, happiest and most thoughtful people everday. They are my family.
cons: Many new processes being rolled out at once. Finding work/life balance can be difficult at times.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Absolutely the best company to work for! Camden as a whole acknowledges the work that you do all the way from the CEO level. I have met both Keith and Ric on several separate occasions. The company dynamic is one of family. They are always involving employees in Outreach Activities in the Community. The pay is great, benefits are awesome, and they are REALLY big into having fun!
cons: Sometimes when Corporate asks us to make changes on-site, and when you are in a busy city with heavy traffic numbers, it's really hard to take the time to schedule that in as well. I wish we could get more help on the Corporate side when there are big projects or changes.

title: I’m Camden Happy!
pros: The pay is great, the culture is amazing and benefits are spectacular! Camden helps to create leaders. By doing this there is a huge level of respect that is passed from upper management to peers. So many positive things come from Camden’s preferred management style of leading by example such as: creating a stronger team with honesty, integrity, understanding, compassion, humility’s, and the cherry on top is that we are empowered to make decisions. Camden also provides a way for all employees the opportunity to voice new innovative policy’s, procedures and ideas. I am so blessed to work for this amazing company!
cons: No cons that I can think of.

title: Love the culture!
pros: I work in the marketing department, but every department within Camden is so helpful. In addition to working closely with the awesome marketing team, I find myself working very closely with Operations, Real Estate Investments, Facilities, and Ancillary Services. I can tell the Camden Culture and it's core values are spread amongst each department because we all work toward the same goal in a friendly and happy manner. Excellent leadership is across departments. I work from home and travel for photoshoots on an as-needed basis and find the work-life balance extremely manageable. Amazing benefits and stock options are provided!
cons: I really can't think of any cons other than perhaps a starting salary could be a bit higher for marketing directors.

title: Culture in the gutter
pros: Slight discount on rent, great insurance
cons: Culture is promoted heavily by corporate in the couple company rallies throughout the year but it is not prevalent in day to day realities. Definitely has a “drink the koolaid” mentality. In actuality the on site team is heavily overworked, sometimes working for 10 day stretches (before the decision was made 2022 for Sunday’s to be closed). Now there are some teams that have no way to have their days off be together, ie since Sunday is an automatic day off they may have to have their second day be Tuesday-Friday based on coverage for the office. So while we no longer have the long stretches, we likely will not have a full “weekend” of time off. Base pay is low. The commission is one of, if not the, lowest in the industry. Employee rent discount is at 20%, but rents have increased by several hundred dollars in the past couple of years. Salary has not so more and more employees are unable to take advantage of the discount. Overall, I have found myself to feel more and more stifled compared to what the promises were when I first started. The big promise is employees first, then shareholders. I’ve put several years into this company, long enough that I can feel that the shift is now not employees first, nor residents first, they are concerned about making more money for the company. Community budgets are being cut and a couple random bonuses were sent out under the guise of “outperforming” when we really know they are aware of the strain they are putting on the on site team and are trying to save face and retain employees.

title: Brown nose your way to the top
pros: Uniforms, benefits and nothing else
cons: Property managers are basically concierges who brown nosed their way to the top. They have no clue of real property management. Its not parties or drinking sessions. It doesn't mean you own your employees or have the right to threaten firing your staff at any point. During interview you are told huge pipe dreams and promised a family organization and once hired the less are exposed. People with no experience cannot lead a properly functioning team and will pull everyone's moral down. Sorry I wasted my time.

title: The Best Corporate Company to Ever Work!
pros: Great Values exemplified throughout the entire company Only company where I've encountered a true welcome on all different kinds of levels with my own personal Mentor (what company assigns a personal mentor to every new employee?) Camden believes in getting the job done but having fun at the same time! Unbelievable perks including Vacation Rentals nationwide Promotes inter-company growths and opinions to make sure your voice is heard! Longevity ranges from 5-25 years or more which speaks true volume for Camden Camden believes in giving back wherever the need may be...gotta love it!
cons: Absolutely nothing that needs to changed!

title: Best Company Ever
pros: Camden has offered me the opportunity to continue to learn and grow as I climb the latter. They create an environment that makes you feel like you as an individual matter rather than being lost in the shuffle of just being an employee. I can reach out to any of my colleagues for assistance no matter which property they are working at and I always find the answer that I set out for.
cons: Some people from the North (New Jersey or New York) seem to associate Camden with Camden New Jersey and Camden New Jersey is a dangerous scary place to live.

title: Not a great experience
pros: will try to give you proper staffing for the volume of traffic and size of community you are on. Salaries are OK, not great. I was fortunate to have a good regional manager who was smart and business savvy, she did her best to keep me.
cons: Commission structure is terrible, they are not competitive and bonuses are even worse. Was on a very distressed property and decided to roll out all kinds of new income producing tools which in the end, ended up being double the work for me and my staff. I have seen alot of recent turnover in staffing this year.

title: Camden cares and shares
pros: Camden offers educational assistance and funds are received prior to the beginning of class. It makes going back to school easier and affordable. Camden cares about my professional and educational goals. Camden shares it earnings with us by giving us yearly bonuses and surprise ones too which also helps in paying tuition.
cons: I don't think there are any downsides of working at Camden. Camden is always ready to assist us financially and emotionally when facing hard times. They figure out solutions to problems and issues they have never had to deal with and will do the right thing that benefits all of us.

title: Lost Sight of Who We Used to Be
pros: -Employee Vacation Suites (When you can reserve them) -Company matches up to 7% for 401k -Great networking/connections
cons: -Employee rent discount barely knocks the dust off the shelf. Rates are skyrocketing but discount remains at 20% & that's FIRM. -Workload for onsite staff especially AM's is becoming unrealistic. There is no way to manage all of what's expected and outperform without things slipping through the cracks. They continue to add more reports/systems in place and it's all tedious. -Work life balance is little to non-existent. We are closed on Sunday, but that Band-Aid of a "relief" just causes things to spill over to the contact center/on site staff later in the week to handle. -Pay is nowhere near "competitive" for what is expected of you. -Company Culture and Values have gone to the gutter, it's all about numbers and penny pinching in EVERY way possible. Tenured employees can agree, the juice is not worth the squeeze. -FAVORTISM, FAVORTISM, FAVORTISM. -LISTEN to your on-site employees who are getting burnt out. Time management & delegation is not the answer to everything. -Rental rates are high and we are told to sell the importance of why due to our service and living excellence. When in reality -If you are on-site and your community has crime incidents, RIP to any hope of reassurance/help from higher up. You may get security for a LIMITED time. Or have them regularly scheduled but reduce what days and times they are at your community to save money. Office staff has to take the heat from residents whose cars are broken into, wheels stolen, catalytic converters etc. -Can be a little micromanaged depending on who your leaders are. -If you're thinking about applying, do your research and ask all the questions. Don't get caught up in the unicorn dust.

title: Politics Over Possibilities
pros: Large company that can offer great benefits; they have a large footprint in major areas and allow for the *possibility* to transfer or advance; great training program to ensure that you are prepared for your job.
cons: Regions are overrun with petty, high-school politics. If you're not buddy-buddy with your District Manager, forget any chances for advancement. Even then, the property managers stick around so long that you would have to move cross-country to opportunities to move up.

title: Leasing Consultant
pros: So many pros! I work with a wonderful team, and have incredible mentors on my side. I have learned so much in my time here, and I still have so much more to learn. There are so many resources provided for you to succeed in your career with Camden, you just have to take advantage of it. I have had the opportunity to help out at other communities, which puts my name out there with other managers as well.
cons: ultant

title: Camden is Amazing!
pros: I started with Camden a few months ago and they have proven that it is a great company to work for! Employees first is a priority and they try their best to make it a fun environment. Benefits are great and company perks are awesome. There is opportunity for growth and development if you utilize your resources properly. I've enjoyed my time at Camden so far!
cons: Camden does not pay as much as some of their competitors. Hopefully they evaluate salaries soon to match or surpass them. Camden is a rapidly growing company and in an area where housing is super expensive, a salary that can accommodate to the escalated prices of housing would be beneficial.

title: The best company I’ve ever worked for
pros: The incentives for leasing are awesome! The culture within this company is amazing. Even on the most stressful days, I love my job, and I love my team! The benefits package is pretty standard and they offer rental discounts to both full time and part time employees. Camden really seems to care about the growth and education of their employees. I have had so many opportunities to learn about this business, and I have so many resources to help me to be successful. I feel like my ideas and opinions are valued by the company, compared to another property management company that I previously worked for.
cons: Nothing. Camden is the absolute best.

title: Low pay, opportunities and micro manage
pros: Great benefits and ways to engage.
cons: Low pay, nesting and saving money on payroll but they don’t discuss what they’re doing which seems disingenuous and sneaky. They Micro manage every single thing you do. Managers can’t manage (waive late fees/cancellation/transfer nope) DM must approve everything.

title: Upper management
pros: Company cares about the employees. Pay with bonuses and paid holidays are awesome. Training in house is a bonus for maintenance tech's and supervisors.
cons: Self-centered upper management with big ego, will push the panic button in a heart beat. Be prepared to wait for a couple of days before you receive a decision on addressing serious issues.

title: A Declining Culture
pros: They own and manage their communities and are very good about completing regular capital projects so that their assets are generally in pretty good shape. If your graduated from Texas A&M, they will give you a job - your work experience and skill level are irrelevant when it comes to hiring Aggies so don’t lowball yourself. - Loved their vacation suite benefit - Pretty good vacation time benefits
cons: It’s very unfortunate because what once really was a fantastic workplace has rapidly declined over the past few years. I’m not speaking to their financials results, only to the employee experience. I really debated sharing the negative because I’m generally not a complainer and there was a time when I really loved this place. However, in the end I decided making it public might encourage someone to make changes to get them back on track. So here it goes... - Blatant favoritism, especially from the VP level - Very low pay - Witnessed sexist remarks by certain members of leadership - Has changed from living the culture and showing team members how to become an active participant in creating culture, to manipulating employees into participating. - Was made to feel like I would be retaliated against if I didn’t answer company surveys favorably or leave positive reviews on the company. - Tried to manipulate me into signing a no arbitration agreement. I believe the exact way it was presented to me was, “yes it is technically ‘optional,’ however, it is in the best interest of the company and would be in My best interest to sign.” I felt certain had I stayed, my not signing would have hindered my growth in the future - again, this is only speculation, just wanted to share how my leader made me feel. - On more than one occasion I witnessed leaders show up to volunteer events, take a photo for company promotional purposes, and then leave without ever actually participating. - Low growth opportunities - Did not feel valued even when I was exceeding my goals

title: Great Job To Work At
pros: Working with Camden is really like working with family even communicating with individuals at different properties that may be in different states. Diversity, Inclusion, Culture, and Values are very important to the company and it shows. The company is now closed on Sundays which makes work/life balance a joy. Raises are given every year based on performance. Education assistance program.
cons: Moving up in the company seems a little difficult to do now with all the changes. It's not harder for a leasing consultant to move up in my opinion.

title: Happy work environment with low pay
pros: The pros depend on your manager. I've heard horror stories but in my experience the managers at Camden tend to be friendly and approachable. The hours are fair and work never feels like work. Camden normally does a great job of picking people who strive to be a part of a team but I've ran into one or two that slipped through the cracks.
cons: The pay!! Other companies pay more for both hourly rate and for commission. The work environment is great but I'm not sure its worth the low pay.

title: #CamdenHappy
pros: Camden has been a great place to work! There is room for advancement if you’re patient or are willing to relocate if you’re looking to advance sooner. The benefits are great especially the Employee Guest Suite, tuition reimbursement, and 401k matching! They offer great training including a one-on-one mentor program that sets new employees up for success and creates lasting relationships between new employees and their mentors.
cons: Nothing I can think of. My only wish was that Camden was still in Las Vegas, but then I wouldn’t have had the privilege to meet and get to know all the great people I have here in Dallas.

title: Camden really is a great place to work!
pros: I enjoy going to work everyday! Camden has a very positive culture and I feel encouraged to learn new skills and grow in my career.
cons: Pay is not as high as some competitors. 3 month delay on health benefits, 6 month delay on retirement benefits.

title: It's been a pretty great company! (But...)
pros: Great owners, fair pay/bonus structure, endless benefits...
cons: "Career wear," ALWAYS have to be open (even in poor weather conditions), too many changes.

title: A dream come TRUE!
pros: - The culture is real, the people are like family. - The benefits are incredible! - Camden truly invests in their people to help them reach their goals - personally and professionally. - This company will take care of you. Whether its in frontline bonuses, emergency relief funds, generous sick/vacation time, CPT will go above and beyond. - Excellent opportunities for growth and promotions. Each day only gets better working for Camden and I wouldn't trade my decision for the world!
cons: - At risk to drink the cool-aide and become Camden obsessed :)

title: HR is worthless
pros: Uniforms make mornings easier. Usually have a decent product.
cons: Mid managers are laughable. Some brown-nose so much that it is sickening. Upper management tries too hard to be friendly and act as though they care when in fact they don't care abut you at all. Again, mid managers can make or break someone becuse they are too immature to know how to handle a situation. That's where HR comes in. They will side with whome ever is more popular. If they don't know you, too bad. You loose! Pitiful. The company promises raises and 0i still haven't gotten mine!

title: Leasing Consultant
pros: thorough continuous training, family environment, room for advancement, personal growth, company values, several community service opportunities.
cons: ultant

title: Great experience
pros: Working for Camden has been such a great experience! Being here for almost 9 years, I can honestly say they have taken really well care of their employees. We really do become family and try to live by our Camden Values! They offer great benefits as well and help pay for school!
cons: We work long hours a day and we work 10 days at a time. It can make it difficult to balance work, school, and family/ fun time. Also, we work Sundays.

title: Decent company, decent pay, upper management clueless to what really goes on
pros: The company provides uniforms for their employees at the time of hire and twice annually. Employees are provided with training which some companies do not provide. The company has a strong brand with the hummingbird and various items that are branded. Camden has a vision for a strong presence on social media sites via facebook, twitter and blogs. They provide annual and holiday bonuses. The health benefits are better than most companies. They provide modern amenities for residents and have online leasing, online rental payments etc. The company recognizes employees but how they get the formula for these awards does not always make sense.
cons: Vacation takes six months to accrue. Training can take months depending on when you are hired. The trainers are sometimes outdated in their teaching methods. At mandatory training you have to pay for your own food for lunch. Some of the site managers are questionable in their ethical and moral actions. Site visits are schefuled allowing employees to prep an unrealistic impression of what the community looks like. People who get promoted seem to be political promotions. There are various cliques and if you're not in you are left out of social events. The "hugging" culture is semi unprofessional when you first meet someone. Sometimes it seems like a competition from upper management to see who can show the most team spirit when other things could have more importance placed on then. There are various inconsistencies in policy management from community to community. It doesn't seem like corporate really listens to residents surveys. Maintenance are paid fairly low for what is required of them.

title: Horrible Experience with HR. I was retaliated against after making a complaint against my supervisor
pros: They have great pay and Bonuses.
cons: Higher management is very unprofessional. They all hardly work and watch each others backs. I was told My complaint to HR about my managers Hostile work environment would be Private and I would not be retaliated against, 2 months later I was fired after 8 years for doing something I was always told I was allowed to do.

title: Camden Contact Center
pros: The pay is one of the best things about it as well as the compensation for working holidays and overtime. The benefits offered are great as well and you should take full advantage of all of the resources they have to offer. CCC employees are so welcoming and greet you with open arms. There are opportunities for you to move up and advance in the company.
cons: There aren't too many cons except for maybe the hours and the days you work change. For some people they like it but others don't.

title: Lost All My Respect
pros: Great Sales Trainings and they did away with ICO Career Wear
cons: Camden likes to get way too involved in employees personal lives. Their latest mandate is that all employees are being required to get vaccinated OR receive a 14 day unpaid suspension. You will be terminated upon your return if you do not have proof of vaccination by October. They like to dictate every aspect of their employees lives.

title: Challenging, evolving, rewarding, and everyone hugs!
pros: Culture first mentality which revolves around hugs. Tools to be successful are in place. Upper management maintains a practice what you preach mentality. Resources to continue your personal development are amazing. Benefits, especially PTO, are top notch.
cons: Employees are so tenured that it creates road blocks for possible advancement unless you are able to relocate.

title: Worked for many but Camden is the very best!
pros: Camden is an employee first company. Our culture is the essence of how we operate, how we treat each other, our customers and even our vendors. It's a culture that is hard describe and at times a bit unbelievable but it's real and makes it near impossible to ever think about working for another company. I've worked for several other multi-family companies in the last 2 decades and none compare to Camden.
cons: I can't think of any at this time.

title: Camden Property Management Review
pros: Although scarce there are still great leaders at Camden that can bring it back to what it claims to be. The benefits are good, the product is great and its reputation with contractors is outstanding. No doubt Camden pays its bills on time and takes care of their communities.
cons: Camden has been an incredible company in the past and will be again if...the principles of the company stop and look at the big picture. Below I have listed some events that I feel support my statement. When the economy took a flying leap of the planet in 2008, Camden made some big changes including semi-dismantling the construction part of the company... regrettable but I can only assume necessary. Unfortunately they placed the head of construction in charge of the operation people side of the company. Maybe they didn't realize they were promoting self-centered, selfish, and self-serving people on a take no prisoners type of mission. For the sake of identification, I will refer to them as the "Houston Mean Team" or HMT. They were responsible for the divide, conquer and eliminate movement that has been going on ever since the HMT took over. As the HMT got their claws in good and solid they began placing their own friends at the top of the food chain. Their true colors didn't start shining through for a while, but enough has happened that the principles have surely noticed. Although the principles verbalize that they appreciate and care about each and every person they employ...the buck stops there. The HMT has systematically eliminated anyone they feel doesn't fit their idea of a "leader". To them a leader doesn't question, state an opinion, disagree or argue, they expect you to do what you’re told, and if it’s not right... too bad...take the blame. The HMT might make you look like you can't handle the position you were hired for or… you are very negative. Camden use to allow for individual thinking and encouraged discussions, opinions and suggestions, to some degree they still do but... no one dares verbalize it. Not if they want to end up out of a job. For the most part the HMT did a good job of making you look bad while they laid track. This process can take a while but to them it’s worth it. Those that take on the HMT might find that they receive an e-mail requesting their presence at the corporate office...the employee might ask if everything is ok...they might be told everything is "perfecto". Once they arrive at corporate they might be greeted by a senior supervisor with a hug and a smile...walk you down to another supervisor’s office with their arm warped around yours as if they are a best friend. Before you even sit down they may tell you they have decided to dismiss you...the employee might ask why they might respond with "it’s in writing in front of you...read it later and leave"...then they might escort you to the elevator...get in with you and smile with great satisfaction all the way down. But they might give you one final demand before you leave...they might tell you that you better not contact your friends at Camden. The HMT's opinion of themselves is so much so they think they have the right to tell you what you can and can't do even after they have kicked you out the door. I remember when the principles use to be proud of how long team members had worked for them, they use to ask us to stand up based on how long we had been there. They would call out One year...more than two...more than 5...and so on. Unfortunately the principles have not asked that question over the last two years...I wonder why... I believe Camden can and will turn it around, there is a young man who is being groomed to take over the family business...as it should be...conversations with him speak volumes about his character...he will bring Camden back to what it was...one of the best places to work.
